Reviews.Title: “Beware giving credit card number!!”
Reviews.Author: jw23mind
Reviews.Content: Don't give them your credit card #!! I gave mine via email to reserve a room. When I had to cancel my trip, I notified them via email MORE THAN A MONTH in advance. They were non-responsive, and proceeded to charge me for the first night's stay anyway. I have had no luck getting them to refund my money, and still no response after multiple attempts to contact. Make sure to get them to produce a written cancellation policy; They never provided me with one, and I could not find one on their website.

Reviews.Title: “For better or worse, you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: teejayemm21
Reviews.Content: There are a variety of complaints on here about the Bicycle Hotel, but we found the place exactly what we expected. It was one of the cheapest places we found in Amsterdam that still afforded us our own room. The room was not high end, but it was a place to sleep and relax at the end of long days. Besides, why stay inside when you're visiting Amsterdam? The breakfast was a step above continental, but decent. The interenet was reliable and they had bikes for rent at a fraction of the cost of some of the other locations around the city. The biggest downside is probably the shared bathroom. We didn't spring for our own. Also the heat on the top floor in August was a bit much on some of the evenings. But again, compared to the price of many other hotels around the city, we got what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: vene-vidi-visitor
Reviews.Content: This 'hotel' is pretty much a place to shower and sleep, not much more. The rooms are small and if you have osteoporosis, vertigo or an inner ear infection the stairs probably make this place a no go for you. That being said the location is okay, as long as you are going to rock it like the locals on a bike or a tram; as the hotel hires bikes for a reasonable price and is very close to a tram stop. Lots of lovely little cafes, bars and restaurants nearby as well as a supermarket. Staff are friendly and helpful and breakfast is basic but adequate. Free wifi is also quite nice for a change! Place was clean but basic and seriously, you are in Amsterdam.... what are you doing sitting in your room?

Reviews.Title: “This is a HOSTEL...not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keri219
Reviews.Content: A friend and I traveled through Europe and were intrigued by the the Bicycle Hotel's website. All the information on their website is falsely advertised. A few examples: Yes, it is a cosy hotel, only, it's NOT a hotel. My friend and I got lucky and stayed across the street in an apartment, but we learned that it the actually "hotel" everyone has to share a bathroom. I have stayed in hostels and that is what they do. "Friendly staff" only if your lucky. I almost got abducted by a man in a car when I was outside and they shrugged it off. "Free wireless internet for laptops" yes that is true, but it doesn't work. Oh, by the way the television in our room didn't work either and the staff didn't care. If lies are your speed and you like living in the stone age, read the website and stay there. On a good note, you can rent bikes which are in good condition and they gave a good map of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off!!!! Smallest room i ever stayed in, shared toliet #Fail”
Reviews.Author: SebBrandt
Reviews.Content: Terrible, rip off, bad breakfast tiny room, steep stairs, no lift.......

Reviews.Title: “second stay - updated review”
Reviews.Author: MelissaDennison
Reviews.Content: Having now stayed at the Bicycle Hotel twice, two years apart, for a total of almost three weeks, I can provide a pretty reliable review! The Bicycle Hotel's strengths are: convenient location, free wifi and internet access (I hate being nickel and dimed for that), and most important, value for money. Amsterdam is an expensive city; you can get a stylish room with crisp linens and fluffy towels, but it will cost you. (Though the Bicycle Hotel's linens and towels are certainly worn, I'm confident that they are clean, as I have personally observed them fresh from the dryer.) The breakfast is adequate (juice, milk, coffee, tea, yogurt, muesli, cereal, bread, honey & jam etc, cheese and salami) and not a bad deal considering that it is included in the price (my hotel in Paris charged 9 euros for an inferior breakfast, to give you an idea). So, I'd stay at the Bicycle Hotel a third time. It's comfortable, and the price is fair for what is delivered.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, mind the stairs”
Reviews.Author: IronRooster2010
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Bicycle Hotel on Van Ostadestraat in De Pijp on our budget honeymoon tour of Europe last September. We were warmly greeted by Gerald and given "the romantic room." I'm not sure if this is specifically the romantic room but our room was cute, comfortable enough, and very purple. We sprang for our own bathroom which, while small, was immaculately clean. The most worrysome characteristic of the hotel (and also one of the most charming) was the stairs. My wife and I were grateful that we had backpacks as the stairs were shallow, near vertical, and turn as you go up. This staircase is not for the faint of heart nor those with bad knees. Breakfast in the morning was continental plus meaning it had cereals, pastries, milk juice, coffee machine and toast but we were also given ham and a nice gouda to go on our toast along with a wide selection of spreads/jellies/jams. We ate well enough and headed out into the city to explore. We liked that bicycles are available for rent (though we did not partake). This is a fantastic base hotel to stay in if you are looking for a clean, friendly hotel to stay in and don't need (or want to pay for) all the frills. The location while not in the middle of everything, is very close to the Albert Cuypmarkt and only a block or two from several tram/bus stops which will get you back to the city center and Amsterdam Centraal within 5-10 mins depending on where you are looking to go. We will stay here again next time we're in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “We wanted to move after 1 night”
Reviews.Author: sulanderson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Amsterdam for our 2nd Anniversary and we selected this hotel after it got a good review in the Guardian. Well boy were we let down. First off the staff were so blaise and completely ineffective. We just wanted to drop our bags off in our room and then venture out. When we arrived our room wasn't ready. When we came back two hours after we were suppose to check-in our room still was ready. Another hour later we went back, but couldn't find a member of staff so we tried our room. We couldn't tell if it had been clean because it was such a dingy little room. This was a hostel and NOT a hotel. The comforters were disgusting and the room was furnished with old Ikea furniture and our towels (when we got them) were thin and barely clean. The toilet room was tiny (we went with the shared option) and the shower room was so disgusting we had to go out and buy flip-flops. There were hairs and mildew everywhere and the drain was clogged. We felt dirty after taking a shower. We were also on the top floor and the staircase was so steep and narrow I had to hold onto the railing to keep from falling down. We only went to breakfast once because it was so bad. There was a toaster at our table and a miserable woman slapped a plate on our table without saying anything. The staff here were horrible!! The breakfast was appalling. We never bothered to rent a bike because it rained the entire time we were there and well we didn't want to deal with the staff. Please don't stay here if you want a nice trip. We wanted to move after our first night but we stupidly paid up front.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: MelissaDennison
Reviews.Content: Actually I stayed at this hotel in June 2009, but just now got around to writing the review. The staff were friendly, very helpful with info etc. The rooms are basic but pleasant have everything you need. The price is reasonable and the location is great - close to tram lines and within walking distance of many Amsterdam sites. I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hostel Conditions at Hotel Prices”
Reviews.Author: cjo30080
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved our time in Amsterdam. Unfortunately, however, we paid $115 euros per night for a private room at the Bicycle Hotel--a room that was equivalent to that normally found at a hostel that would charge half that amount. There was no room service whatsoever, no decor whatsoever, old/thin towels, a tiny television from the 80's, and furniture that appeared to have been picked up at a yard sale. On the plus side, wi-fi was free and a free continental breakfast was included. Also, the place was generally quiet, the rooms were clean, the location was a little off the beaten path (but not too bad) and the folks working there couldn't have been nicer. (Fair warning: They don't tell you this when you book your reservation, but if you pay with a credit card, they charge you four percent extra. Not cool.)

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: Gemrah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the bicycle hotel for 4 nights over the weekend of Queensday. The guy who ran the hotel was really friendly and helpful, and provided us with a good map. Even though we got there quite early our room was ready so we could check in. We'd booked a double room, but were actually in an apartment which was a nice surprise. Apartment was nice and clean. Some people have complained about the stairs which were quite steep but fine for us. Breakfast was good, a nice range of food and plenty of it. Location - about 15 mins walk from leidesplan, and maybe 20 mins from Dam square but there are loads of trams. Not a luxury hotel but very good value for money in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place- But beware of the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: LCM79
Reviews.Content: Bicycle Hotel was a great, out of the centre base if your planning on being out for most of the day! I booked through a hostel company so I wasn't expecting much, however when we got there I was pleasently suprised! The comunal space was clean and inviting and the staff were superb. There was free internet access within the communal area and you could hire bikes with them if you wanted to. The only issue had a couple of issues, one being the stairs in the place. I had booked for 5 of us to stay, so I had a couple of rooms booked out, theses happened to be on the top floor, which didn't seem so bad when the member of staff handed me our keys, that was until I stood at the bottom of the stairs...they are near vertical and horrendous for getting luggage up. Get back down was even more of a nightmare as you couldn't see the next step infront properly, I had to resort to coming down them in the ballet 1st position (feet outwards!) the whole way down. You had to make sure you had everything with you before you left your room as the hike back up just didn't seem worth it! Apart from that, everything was great! The staff were great, when we first got there, we had arrived early and they let us leave our bags with them while we went for a wander about. They also helped with the tram system and how was best to get into the centre. The surrounding areas of the hotel were nice and a lot less crowded and hectic than Amsterdam centre, there's a great market just a couple of streets away, where you can litlerally buy anything! Just a short walk up from the hotel is a square with good restaraunts, and during the day there is a cake shop that can only be seen to be believed! There is also a great pub right near the bicycle hotel which is very friendly and welcoming. Overall, great place to stay with everything you could need!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a weekend”
Reviews.Author: Expatastic
Reviews.Content: Having looked at a lot of reviews for budget hotels in Amsterdam and seeing that most of them are abysmal, we found the Bicycle Hotel to be perfectly sufficient. Finding it was difficult, in large part because we missed our tram stop, but once you're a block away you can't miss it, thanks to the bicycles bolted to the 2nd floor of the building's facade. The hotel was pretty clean, although for a longer stay, I would probably spring for something a little nicer. The bathroom in our triple room upstairs didn't smell fantastic, for example. Our room had nice big windows, a TV with an English language channel (though why you would want to spend time in Amsterdam watching TV I don't know), and three adequate beds. Tram stops aren't far away, which is nice because it's a bit of a hike (although completely doable) to the centre of town. A lot of reviewers on TripAdvisor freak out about small things, but you get what you pay for, and this place does the trick for a weekend. It's hard to beat the price, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget stay”
Reviews.Author: yellowsub101
Reviews.Content: This was our first stop during our 3-week long Europe trip. It has a great location near transit, and is also a short walk from the 'Daily Market' on Albert Cuypstraat - a convenient place to get cheap souvenirs. The van Gogh/Rijks/Stedelijk museums are about a 15 minute walk, and you'll want to take transit to the train station/flower market/Anne Frank house. Our room was on the fourth floor - up several flights of steep steps. The room was small but clean, and we shared a toilet and shower with four other rooms (not very clean). Breakfast was great, free internet, and the staff were very helpful in recommending authentic Dutch places to eat and how to navigate the transit system.

Reviews.Title: “decent quarters”
Reviews.Author: AMGA
Reviews.Content: the hotel was decent ,clean ,comfortable.there was much to see right around the neightborhood,De,Pijp.Cafe Roos,made me feel like home.all was good around the area I,d rate this place excellent . alaska man AMGA

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, but do it yourself”
Reviews.Author: Amadelmerol
Reviews.Content: The pros: The hotel is nice, near a Tram Station, a supermaket. and many restaurants. The breakfast is quite decent, and the staff is really nice, in fact they are the best feature of this hotel. You have two computers with internet acces to use for free. Reasonable price in Amsterdam. The cons: Don't expect any cleaning service while you are in the hotel. I wasn't sure if the sheets were clean or not, I didn't wanted to know but stains are not good in any bed. Stairs are dangerous, but I think it is normal in Amsterdam, Bathroom's plumbery is not very good. You can't use the computers before 8 am or after 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You :)”
Reviews.Author: choonhiong
Reviews.Content: I am from singapore. I travelled to amsterdam and stayed in bicycle hotel for three days... I like it for its coziness, not noisy as compared to a hostel or backpackers I stayed in London where they are too many backpackers crowding and drinking and making lots of noise I also appreciate for the free wireless internet where i can bring my laptop to surf net in my own room :) (however please check with bicycle hotel staff cause it only reach a certain level of floors) IMPORTANT: I loan out a bicycle from them and it somehow disppear or got stolen when I park my bicycle at the central train station (I definitely lock it cause I heard many cases of stolen bicycles)... I reported it to the hotel and they charge me i think for 100 or 150 EURO through credit card for the loss of the bicycle and the most amazing thing is that a few days later (when I returned to London), I got an email from a staff called Marjolein and she mentioned that they have found the bicycle and will not charge me :)... i really appreciate for their honesty and their after service. It is a hotel that I can trust and will not hesitate to recommend to my friends and if I can go to amsterdam again, will stay in this hotel again... anyway this hotel i do think it is more ideal for young people, anyway as what other people has mentioned, the staircase is steep... overall with regards to the room... i think it is clean, you are paying for what it is worth, I reckon it is a rate for a third star hotel plus that they already have excellent service... so be realistic about your expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Bicycle Hotel is great! Cool staff, clean, good location&bicycle rental!”
Reviews.Author: BobJJ
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay in the Bicycle hotel. The hotelstaff was very cool & helpfull. They told me what the best places were to go out. I had the best party in my life! Amsterdam is the place to be! The location was great. A lot of restaurants and pubs on walking distance from the hotel. My room was clean and very nice (I liked the pictures on the wall...) I also rent a bicycle. It wasn't easy to ride on, but I enjoyed it so much... I really recommend you to stay at the Bicycle hotel. It was great!!!I'm hoping to come back next year...

Reviews.Title: “Spot On Hotel For What You Pay”
Reviews.Author: RoyPartington
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year 2006 and as a professional who stays at 5 star hotels through my work all over the world Im used too staying at some of the best hotels in the world, however for what you pay for at the Bicycle Hotel I REALLY CANT UNDERSTAND WHY SOME PEOPLE ARE COMPLAINING about this hotel. It was in a nice quiet residential part of Amsterdam, so really quiet in the mornings ie no traffic or trams going by your window every 5 mins which is a big problem in a lot of hotels in amsterdam. Its a couple on mins walk to the nearest tram which takes 5 - 10 mins I guess to dam square and the red light area, about the same for the Liedersplein as well. You can rent bikes off the hotel which is great when your drunk, BE CAREFULL NOT TOO LOOSE YOUR BIKE OR HAVE IT STOLEN AS YOU PAY THE HOTEL THE FULL ASKING PRICE FOR THE BIKE, trust me the bikes aint worth that much but you do get warned that your liable for the bikes if their stolen or lost, they provide you with 2 locks big enough to lock a motor bike up with, (We did have a problem remembering where we left our bikes after a night on the beer mind you). The rooms Nothing too shout about But also nothing to complain about either, Clean tidy, nice enough bed, Shower, after all you only want somewhere to get your head down and have a lie in when you have a hangover. The stairs are steep, But show me an old hotel in Amsterdam that does not have steep stairs and small rooms, This is amsterdam they all have steep stairs and small rooms unless you pay for a swish modern hotel like the Marriot/Hilton etc. Conclusion Perfect for what you pay NO COMPLAINTS FROM ME

Reviews.Title: “Hostel or Hotel?”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_Boston
Reviews.Content: I will rate the basics first - then provide some details on limitations of this hotel. Hotel Staff: Very Friendly, and helpful (4/5) Common Area & Breakfast: Basic, Nice - Friendly (3/5) Check-In: Very Easy - Smooth (5/5) Check-Out: Very Easy - Smooth (5/5) Room? Well ... we were traveling with 4 adults and needed a room for 4. The Bicycle Hotel is not suited for 4 adults. One of our friends was on a 'porch' without heat and nearly froze to death ... but his intoxication likely saved him. The bathroom was functional, not much else. The common bathroom was functional, and fairly clean. The room/hotel was more of a Hostel than a Hotel. I think it is a little misleading in definition/naming. The stairway is very difficult for lugging backpacks, and quite dangerous. The public transport is about a 10 minute walk ... We ended up checking out on day two and moving the Marriott in Leidseplein ... that was an awesome part of town ...

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: kipparachel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights and found it to be a very comfortable stay. we were on the fourth floor and the stairs are very steep, pretty tricky getting your luggage up and down. The room was clean with very comfy beds, a tv and sink. The toilet and shower were just across the hall which four rooms shared. The hotel has two computers both with internet, they also hire out bikes at 5 euros a day. This is a must!!! it was a great way to get about and see more of Amsterdam although my friend struggled at first and fell off. Staff are very helpful and provide a map on your arrival highlighting the best places to eat and drink. I reccomend this hotel for anyone, we would go back again. R & G Southampton UK

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent for the price you pay, it's very clean, the staff are very friendly, I would definetly go back. It's not right in the centre but it's very easy to get to and only about a five min tram ride to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: for the same price as staying in a hostel dormitory, my friends and i were able to stay in a room in this little hotel. for amsterdam, the price is good. also, if you aren't particularly looking for luxury acommodations, and have a limited budget, this place really has everything that one needs. i found our room to be clean, though tiny - really nothing fancy, but to be honest, i didn't expect anything better for what we paid. the bathroom and shower room were also clean and well maintained. the hotel staircase was insanely narrow and steep, so i don't recommend going there if you're lugging a ton of luggage. even hauling our small suitcases proved to be a challenging feat due to the severity of the incline - though i hear that stairs like that are indeed commom in amsterdam. the most enjoyable component of the hotel was the breakfast room downstairs. the staff was friendly, relaxed, and able to deal calmly with even the most annoying guests imaginable. breakfast in the hotel was nice, an ideal way to start off our days in amsterdam. though it rained during most of our stay, we rented bikes during our final day, which i think should be a mandatory highlight of any holland stay.

Reviews.Title: “Backpacker Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are dirty, with mildew on the blanket, stains on the sheets and carpet. The private shower smelled of urine. The staff were nice but did not know much about their city and gave poor directions. No staff after 11. The rooms are backpacker rooms and they are worth maybe $40 US, not $80 plus. Frommers gives this hotel 2 out of 3 stars, but I doubt if they ever visited the place. Seek other hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Bicycle Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Van Ostadestraat 123 | The Pijp, Amsterdam 1072 SV, The Netherlands
